intro: Streptanthus secundus, commonly known as the California gorse, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, and it has narrow, grass-like leaves. Streptanthus secundus typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions and is often found in coastal regions.
